ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral symmetrical gradually sloping mild to severe hearing loss with air-conduction thresholds consistent with sensorineural origin.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Hearing loss configuration and onset are consistent with age-related progression in an 88-year-old patient.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess perceived hearing handicap (HHIE) and identify specific communication needs (COSI).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate a bilateral symmetrical mild to severe sensorineural hearing loss with excellent speech recognition potential. Self-report scales reveal a mild perceived handicap but specific difficulties with TV, telephone, and home conversations.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical gradually sloping mild to severe sensorineural hearing loss (250-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 38 dB HL AU; Word Recognition Scores excellent (96%) bilaterally at elevated levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A bilaterally with normal ear canal volume and middle ear pressure.

tests.name: Self-report scales
tests.result_summary: HHIE score 22 (mild handicap); COSI identified needs for home conversations, telephone, and television.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Patient fitted with custom hearing aids incorporating retention strategies to address history of loss.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Fitting
tests.result_summary: Fitted with mid-level full-shell ITE hearing aids with 2.5mm vent, controls deactivated, and retention tether attached; verified with REM.

proposed_items: Custom ITE hearing aids with physical retention system (tether/clip)
Pocketalker personal amplifier with supra-aural headphones
counseling_actions: Instruction on hearing aid insertion, removal, and use of retention clip
Instruction on use and functionality of HAT devices (Pocketalker, TV headset, captioned phone)

escalation.rationale_short: Routine follow-up to assess benefit of recommended devices.

follow_up_plan.objective: To assess the benefit of the fitted devices and verify usability.

expected_outcome: Hearing aids were returned for credit after 2 weeks due to lack of benefit, poor retention, and inability to manage the devices (wrong batteries inserted, low usage).
Pocketalker personal amplifier: Patient indicated improved understanding of conversation at home and in her church group.
Wireless TV headset: Patient reported being able to enjoy television much more without the volume bothering others.
Captioned telephone: Patient and daughter reported improvement in conversation, especially with voicemail transcription.
COSI: Ratings indicated perceived improvement in all identified areas using the HAT devices.
